StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveMedicalInforma.on]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @PersonID uniqueiden..er, @HealthRecLoca.on varchar(50), @DentalRecLoca.on varchar(50), @DentExamDate date.me, @HIVExamDate date.me, @MammogramExamDate date.me, @PAPExamDate date.me, @PhysicalExamDate date.me ) AS
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM [ACP].[MedicalInfo] WHERE [PersonId] = @PersonId) BEGIN
UPDATE [ACP].[ACP].[MedicalInfo] SET [HealthRecLoca.on] = @HealthRecLoca.on, [DentalRecLoca.on] = @DentalRecLoca.on, [DentExamDate] = @DentExamDate, [HIVExamDate] = @HIVExamDate, [MammogramExamDate] = @MammogramExamDate, [PAPExamDate] = @PAPExamDate, [PhysicalExamDate] = @PhysicalExamDate WHERE [PersonId] = @PersonId
END ELSE BEGIN
INSERT INTO [ACP].[ACP].[MedicalInfo] ([PersonId], [HealthRecLoca.on], [DentalRecLoca.on], [DentExamDate], [HIVExamDate], [MammogramExamDate], [PAPExamDate], [PhysicalExamDate]) VALUES (@PersonID ,@HealthRecLoca.on ,@DentalRecLoca.on ,@DentExamDate ,@HIVExamDate ,@MammogramExamDate ,@PAPExamDate ,@PhysicalExamDate) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully, commit the transac.on COMMIT TRANSACTION
